title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: A new preprint server welcomes papers written and reviewed by AI
items.description: With human peer review struggling to keep pace with machine-generated science, aiXiv enlists bots to help

items.title: U.S. military funds AI tools to speed modeling of viral outbreaks
items.description: DARPA program could yield models of disease spread in days instead of weeks

items.title: Replenishing sapped groundwater could trigger small earthquakes
items.description: A boom in aquifer injection projects could unlock long-quiet faults

items.title: The first patients have been helped by cancer-fighting cells made directly in their bodies
items.description: Novel approach could be faster, and cheaper, than making the cells in the lab—but safety concerns linger

items.title: What an FDA veteran thinks a controversial vaccine email gets right—and wrong
items.description: Phil Krause applauds call by top agency official Vinay Prasad for better data, but says his approach is “destructive”

items.title: Cosmic neutrinos’ kink could help explain origins of the elusive particles
items.description: Energy spectrum of elusive particles shows an intriguing bump, giant IceCube experiment reports

items.title: Can adding light sensors to nerve cells switch off pain, epilepsy, and other disorders?
items.description: Optogenetics is poised to move from a research tool to new therapies—if scientists can show it’s safe

items.title: The strongest spiderweb on Earth is spun only by females
items.description: Bark spider silk is stronger than steel, but males make a weaker version

items.title: Warm, humid ‘atmospheric rivers’ threaten Antarctica
items.description: Growing more common as climate warms, these once-rare events could ultimately accelerate ice loss

items.title: Journal retracts weed killer study backed by Monsanto, citing ‘serious ethical concerns’
items.description: Highly cited paper was used as evidence that the widely used herbicide Roundup is safe
